title: Firing by Indian troops injures 5 civilians in Nikial Sector: DG ISPR
content:
RAWALPINDI, Jul 06 (APP):Â  Indian Army troops targeted civilian population along the line of control and injured five innocent civilians, in unprovoked ceasefire violation Director General Inter Services Public Relations (DG ISPR) Major General Babar Iftikhar Monday said.
In a tweet, the ISPR DG said as many as five civilians, including two innocent boys and two elderly women, got injured due to Indian Army troops unprovoked CFV in Nikial Sector, along LoC, targeting civil population late last night.
He added that Pakistan Army troops responded effectively to Indian firing.
